content:
• Tuesday, July 10, 2012
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) is down 4.5% AH thanks to hhgregg's guidance cut. The fact hhgregg's...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) is down 4.5% AH thanks to hhgregg's guidance cut. The fact hhgregg's (NYSE:HGG) cut was blamed on weak video (i.e. TV) sales has to be especially worrisome to Best Buy investors, given hopes that sales of TV sets, which tend to be sales-intensive, would hold up relatively well against the e-commerce onslaught. Perhaps recent manufacturer efforts to limit discounts ended up backfiring.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • GG

    Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) -4% AH after lowering its 2012 gold production guidance to 2.35M-2.45M oz.,...

    Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) -4% AH after lowering its 2012 gold production guidance to 2.35M-2.45M oz., below prior guidance of 2.6M. The lower production will lead to an average cash cost of $310-340/oz. on a by-product basis and $625-$650/oz. on a co-product basis, below prior guidance of $250-$275 and $550-$600. Goldcorp blames de-stressing activities at its Red Lake mine, and water shortages at its Peñasquito mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • HGG

    Shares of hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) get crushed in after-hours trading after the company says that it...

    Shares of hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) get crushed in after-hours trading after the company says that it sees same-store sales falling even more than it originally anticipated in FY13 and cuts its outlook for FY13 EPS to $0.90-$1.05, from prior guidance of $1.12-$1.27. The company says lower than expected sales in its video category contributed to the revised outlook. Shares -22.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) takes advantage of its nice run, announcing a secondary offering...

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) takes advantage of its nice run, announcing a secondary offering of 21M shares, and granting the underwriter an option for up to an additional 3.15M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 10 Comments
  • VOXX

    Audiovox (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ1 EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.27. Revenue of $194M (+17.4% Y/Y) misses...

    Audiovox (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ1 EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.27. Revenue of $194M (+17.4% Y/Y) misses by $13M. Shares -14.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • OCZ

    More on OCZ's FQ1: No explanation is given for the miss, though it's likely falling solid-state...

    More on OCZ's FQ1: No explanation is given for the miss, though it's likely falling solid-state drive prices played a role. Sales of high-end PCI Express solutions fell 24% Q/Q, and only made up 5% of revenue. OCZ expects FQ2 revenue of $130M-$140M and FY13 (ends in Feb.) revenue of $630M-$700M, compared with consensus estimates of $132.7M and $653.9M. Gross margin is expected to increase from FQ1's 25.2%, and end FY13 above 30%. OCZ -7.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -21.8%) has now lost over a fifth of its value thanks to a harsh Citron Research...

    Questcor (QCOR -21.8%) has now lost over a fifth of its value thanks to a harsh Citron Research report. Piper (Outperform) defends the company by arguing generic drugs aren't a risk to Acthar sales, and would require a 30-month stay in the event of a filing. However, the generic threat was just one of several issues raised by Citron.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 2 Comments

  • Oil plunges following Cummins cutting its outlook, WTI crude -2.4% to $83.94. Copper gives up...

    Oil plunges following Cummins cutting its outlook, WTI crude -2.4% to $83.94. Copper gives up earlier gains, now -1.3%. Gold - which can't seem to rally on any news - falls to session lows and near its 2012 low, -1.4% to $1,567.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI -8.7%) dives, its solvency called into question as a regulator has yet to give...

    MBIA (MBI -8.7%) dives, its solvency called into question as a regulator has yet to give one of its units permission to make an interest payment due next week. MKM's Harry Fong says it's a buying opportunity as the payment is not due if not approved by regulators, meaning a missed payment does not equal default.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson (MJN -4.5%) dived in afternoon trading following a report from a Chinese site that...

    Mead Johnson (MJN -4.5%) dived in afternoon trading following a report from a Chinese site that a baby milk product it sells in the country was found to contain a banned additive. However, shares have now recouped a decent chunk of their losses. Some of MJN's rivals also have regulatory problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP -0.4%) eliminates 350 jobs at its home office as part of a restructuring effort...

    J.C. Penney (JCP -0.4%) eliminates 350 jobs at its home office as part of a restructuring effort that was announced previously. Cynics will quickly note that CEO Ron Johnson survived the cut. (Previous: JCP's Q2 forecast to be worse than Q1)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV -9.7%) trades weak after a cut in 2012 revenue estimates from Cummins doesn't bode...

    Navistar (NAV -9.7%) trades weak after a cut in 2012 revenue estimates from Cummins doesn't bode well for the company. Just to make things even more interesting with the company, a fresh 13G from Franklin Resources reveals the company holds a 18.8% stake giving it a rather strong voice to use with fellow investors Carl Icahn and Mark Rachesky.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 5 Comments
  • MMR

    McMoran Exploration (MMR -9.9%) posts a bigger loss than sector rivals after tripping up on...

    McMoran Exploration (MMR -9.9%) posts a bigger loss than sector rivals after tripping up on technical selling indicators. Volume has been picking up on the name over the last few weeks, as chatter on the success of the company's projects keeps going back and forth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 7 Comments
  • CMI

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -4.4% after it cutting its full-year revenue outlook for 2012 to be in line...

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -4.4% after it cutting its full-year revenue outlook for 2012 to be in line with 2011's $18.05B vs. previous guidance for an increase of 10%. Analyst expect $19.84B. The firm also forecasts Q2 revenues of $4.45B vs. $4.64B last year and consensus of $5.07B. More positively, Cummins raises its quarterly dividend to $0.50 a share from $0.40. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW +4.5%) shoots higher after announcing a deal that will see it provide...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW +4.5%) shoots higher after announcing a deal that will see it provide search technology for Kforce (KFRC +3.1%). The company says its 6Sense Semantic Search technology will be used across the entire Kforce platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) +4.3% amid heavy trading and continuing the upward trend...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) +4.3% amid heavy trading and continuing the upward trend it's enjoyed since April over excitement about its Belviq obesity treatment. SA author Efsinvestment says that with a Relative Strength Index of 65%, the stock needs a breather, although it will be worth buying after any pullback.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • AONEQ

    GE's plans to invest $170M in boosting battery production has helped send A123 Systems (AONE...

    GE's plans to invest $170M in boosting battery production has helped send A123 Systems (AONE -5.8%) shares below the $1 threshold yet again. GE owns a sizable stake in A123, courtesy of multiple investments.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 6 Comments
  • CRUS

    iPhone component suppliers Cirrus Logic (CRUS -7.6%) and TriQuint (TQNT -4.1%) are off sharply....

    iPhone component suppliers Cirrus Logic (CRUS -7.6%) and TriQuint (TQNT -4.1%) are off sharply. Recent supply-chain data pointing to a major decline in Apple orders ahead of the next iPhone's launch could be playing a role. However, other iPhone suppliers are only posting declines in-line with the broader chip sector (SOXX -1.6%), hurt by AMD's warning. OVTI -1.7%. SWKS -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -11.5%), which opened today near its all-time high, plunges after Citron Research...

    Questcor (QCOR -11.5%), which opened today near its all-time high, plunges after Citron Research issues a report (.pdf) questioning the sustainability of Acthar gel sales. Citron points to the decades-old availability of similar generic products, Novartis' launch of a synthetic alternative, and insurance industry pushback. Citron also goes after Questcor's low R&D spending and unexplained marketing expenses. (yesterday) (TheStreetSweeper)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • JAGGF

    Junior gold miner Jaguar Mining (JAG -16.7%) comments on unusual trading in its stock,...

    Junior gold miner Jaguar Mining (JAG -16.7%) comments on unusual trading in its stock, saying it is unaware of any developments that would "merit such activity." The stock seems destined for OTC Bulletin Board, -87% YTD and trading at $0.80. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    More on JCP (previous): You can't have a turnaround until you hit a bottom, which according to...

    More on JCP (previous): You can't have a turnaround until you hit a bottom, which according to Credit Suisse's Michael Exstein is still around the corner for J.C. Penney. The analyst calls for a $0.50/share loss in Q2, after initially targeting the loss at $0.31/share. The company has shaken the confidence of vendors by slowing or canceling orders due to the persistent sales slump. JCP -3.5% to $21.26, a new 52-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum (QTM-OLD -26.2%) gets crushed after preannouncing FQ1 revenue of $141M and EPS of -$0.03...

    Quantum (QTM-OLD -26.2%) gets crushed after preannouncing FQ1 revenue of $141M and EPS of -$0.03 to -$0.04, below a consensus of $155.1M and breakeven. The maker of low-end storage/backup hardware blames soft Euro demand and "challenges closing large deals across all regions in the last few weeks." XRTX -3.7% in sympathy, but other names with heavy enterprise storage exposure don't seem to be affected.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -3.4%) releases its June audience metrics. Listener hours totaled 1.08B, +77% Y/Y but...

    Pandora (P -3.4%) releases its June audience metrics. Listener hours totaled 1.08B, +77% Y/Y but -2% from May, which had one extra day. The company's share of U.S. radio listening is pegged at 5.98%, compared with 5.8% in May and 3.37% in the year-ago period. Active listeners came in at 54.5M vs. 53.3M in May and 36.1M in June '11. Pandora is selling off, but so are other volatile Internet names. YELP -7.4%. GRPN -5.6%. ZNGA -3.6%. (May metrics)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 8 Comments
  • SODA

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA -5.3%) fall off with negative comments on GMCR tipping sentiment a...

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA -5.3%) fall off with negative comments on GMCR tipping sentiment a bit and questions on the company's upcoming earnings report helping to lead to increased volatility. The company's sales numbers in Europe and the impact of foreign exchange will be on the radar for traders until the report settles the issue.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -3%) makes new lows yet again after RBC predicts Q2 and Q3 results will be ugly. The...

    Nokia (NOK -3%) makes new lows yet again after RBC predicts Q2 and Q3 results will be ugly. The firm is worried about the fact current Lumia Windows Phones can't be upgraded to Windows Phone 8, and that Microsoft has become more vocal about diversifying its Windows Phone partner base. Some positive data comes from a Nielsen survey that indicates high customer satisfaction for the Lumia 900: 95% of owners say they'd recommend the phone to others.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 8 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -6.1%) trades lower after catching some more flak from...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -6.1%) trades lower after catching some more flak from David Einhorn on CNBC. "Yeah, Keurig is on the way out," was the quote that cut to the bone. Despite all the wild price swings in GMCR during the year, over the last month the stock has traded in a tighter range.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (FST -6.5%) slumps after providing announcing Q2 sales volumes and issuing 2H...

    Forest Oil (FST -6.5%) slumps after providing announcing Q2 sales volumes and issuing 2H production and capex guidance. 2H net sales volumes are expected to decline 2%-5%, as declining natural gas production offsets increasing crude production. Capex is expected to drop 52%-56% to $190M-$210M, as Forest dials back its Eagle Ford shale investments. RBC is downgrading shares to Sector Perform in response. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • MAKO

    "Even with more rational.growth expectations, MAKO could still be a winning stock," writes SA...

    "Even with more rational...growth expectations, MAKO could still be a winning stock," writes SA author Stephen Simpson after the company's sales warning yesterday, which has sent the shares into a 40% tailspin. However, "the burden is now back on management to prove that the RIO is an in-demand system" that really is needed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • AMD

    Nomura suggests AMD's (AMD -8.4%) Q2 warning isn't just demand-related, but also reflects a...

    Nomura suggests AMD's (AMD -8.4%) Q2 warning isn't just demand-related, but also reflects a weakening desktop CPU position in the wake of Intel's (INTC -1% - previous) Ivy Bridge launch. Goldman also thinks market share issues could be a factor. The fact Intel and Nvidia (NVDA -1.3%) are off just modestly indicates the Street thinks some of AMD's problems are company-specific. Jefferies, however, argues low inventories, lower multiples, and stable gross margins make AMD a buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • BMTI

    BioMimetic Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BMTI) soars 16.1% after submitting more information to the FDA...

    BioMimetic Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BMTI) soars 16.1% after submitting more information to the FDA about its Augment treatment, saying that the bone-graft product is not inferior to autograft. The agency decided not to OK Augment in January, when it asked for the additional data. BioMimetic now expects a decision on approval next year or in early 2014. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • WWW

    Wolverine World Wide (WWW +4.1%) trades higher despite missing estimates with its Q2 report. The...

    Wolverine World Wide (WWW +4.1%) trades higher despite missing estimates with its Q2 report. The retailer gave investors something to latch onto by backing its FY12 guidance and disclosing that Sperry Top-Sider, Saucony, Stride Rite, and Keds brands purchase from Collective Brand will be added to its lineup in late summer to early fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • CALL

    MagicJack VocalTec (CALL +18.3%) takes off after stating it expects Q2 revenue of $37.5M-$38.5M...

    MagicJack VocalTec (CALL +18.3%) takes off after stating it expects Q2 revenue of $37.5M-$38.5M and EPS of $0.48-$0.52, above a consensus of $35.9M and $0.36. In addition, the provider of plug-n-play VoIP gear is now guiding for 2012 EPS of $1.50-$1.80, above a prior range of $1.25-$1.70 and a consensus of $1.36. It exited Q2 with 19.4M shares outstanding, down from 21.1M at the end of Q1. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +51.1%) skyrockets after Golden Gate Capital opens ups its wallet to...

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +51.1%) skyrockets after Golden Gate Capital opens ups its wallet to provide a liquidity boost of $65M in loans. The specialty retailer also reiterated its Q2 guidance. Despite the rally, shares are still off over 32% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C Penney (JCP -4.3%) break lower in early trading after Credit Suisse cuts estimates...

    Shares of J.C Penney (JCP -4.3%) break lower in early trading after Credit Suisse cuts estimates on the company. Analysts with the firm say sales at the retailer are trailing the Q1 numbers, which to put it mildly, left investors unimpressed when they were released.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM +4.2%) rallies after Oppenheimer starts coverage with an Outperform and $17...

    Millennial Media (MM +4.2%) rallies after Oppenheimer starts coverage with an Outperform and $17 PT. After nearly doubling on IPO day in late March, shares are trading right around their $13 offering price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) -6.5% after warning it expects FY12 (ends in Oct.) revenue and...

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) -6.5% after warning it expects FY12 (ends in Oct.) revenue and EPS to be below prior guidance ranges of $9.1B-$9.5B and  $0.85-$0.95 (consensus stands at $9.5B and $0.94). AMAT blames weak chip equipment demand from foundries. Lower in sympathy: KLAC -1.9%. LRCX -2.5%. However, ASML is up 8.2% following its deal with Intel, and rival Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI) is up 3.5%. Recent data has suggested the chip equipment industry's recovery is stalling.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures join in with the broad rally that EU shares are enjoying...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures join in with the broad rally that EU shares are enjoying following yesterday's eurozone deal to rescue Spanish banks, with yields on 10-year Spanish and Italian bonds plunging in relief. The S&P benchmark is +0.1%, while crude is -0.8% after the government averts a worker lockout in Norway. Mako Surgical tumbles 40% following an earnings warning. Later: IBD/TIPP Economic Optimism
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • XSPA

    Premarket gainers: VRNG +11%. ASML +8%. CALL +7%. GEVA +5%. Losers: MAKO -40%. JRCC -17%. AMBT...

    Premarket gainers: VRNG +11%. ASML +8%. CALL +7%. GEVA +5%.
    Losers: MAKO -40%. JRCC -17%. AMBT -11%. BZH -9%. AMD -9%. CHTP -7%. AMAT -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy (NASDAQ:HELE) -10.4% after its FQ1 EPS misses forecasts and the difficult retail...

    Helen of Troy (NASDAQ:HELE) -10.4% after its FQ1 EPS misses forecasts and the difficult retail environment prompts it to cut FQ 2013 guidance to $3.70-$3.80 from an April forecast of $3.80-$3.90. Consensus is for $3.90. Net profit falls $23.5M from $24.6M, partly due to an increase in tax expenses from acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • BZH

    Beazer Homes (NYSE:BZH) -9.8% after saying it will offer $75M in common stock and the same...

    Beazer Homes (NYSE:BZH) -9.8% after saying it will offer $75M in common stock and the same amount in tangible equity units. Of the proceeds, the home builder plans invest up to $100M in real-estate in Florida, California, Texas, North Carolina and Arizona. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -4.8%) CEO Simon Pedder quits with immediate effect, and the company...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -4.8%) CEO Simon Pedder quits with immediate effect, and the company says its intends to "significantly reduce" its workforce and explore strategic options. The drama comes a week after the FDA requested another trial for Chelsea's hypotension drug Northera. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • AMD

    Intel looks like an attractive short at these levels, says JPMorgan, noting AMD is off 30% over...

    Intel looks like an attractive short at these levels, says JPMorgan, noting AMD is off 30% over the past 90 days, and Intel down just 6%. (see last night's AMD warning) INTC -1.4% premarket. (via Notable Calls)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM | 6 Comments

  • Corn futures for July delivery climbed 4% to $7.7525 a bushel yesterday, increasing the...

    Corn futures for July delivery climbed 4% to $7.7525 a bushel yesterday, increasing the drought-induced surge of the last three weeks to 29% and bringing the price close to the all-time record of $7.9975. With little rainfall expected in the corn belt in the next two weeks, the gains could continue and soon start affecting food prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 AM
